title: Adrián Sardinero
text:
Adrián Sardinero Corpa (born 13 October 1990) is a Spanish <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for Australian club <a href="Perth%20Glory%20F.C.">Perth Glory</a> as a <a href="Midfielder%23Winger">winger</a>.
Club career.
Sardinero was born in <a href="Legan%C3%A9s">Leganés</a>, <a href="Madrid">Madrid</a>. After emerging through local <a href="Getafe%20CF">Getafe CF</a>'s youth ranks, he made his senior debut in 2008, helping the <a href="Getafe%20CF%20B">B team</a> promote to <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20B">Segunda División B</a> for the first time ever in <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Tercera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">his second year</a>.
On 30 September 2010, one month before his 20th birthday, Sardinero made his debut for the main squad, playing 20 minutes in a 2–0 away loss against <a href="BSC%20Young%20Boys">BSC Young Boys</a> in <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20UEFA%20Europa%20League">the group stage</a> of the <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a>. One month later, in a home fixture against the same <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a> opponent – in the same competition – he scored the game's only goal, all this before having appeared in <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> for the club.
Sardinero scored his first Spanish top-flight goal on 2 April 2011, netting in the last minutes of a 2–4 home defeat to <a href="Valencia%20CF">Valencia CF</a> after coming on as a <a href="Substitute%20%28association%20football%29">substitute</a> for <a href="Borja%20Fern%C3%A1ndez%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201981%29">Borja Fernández</a> midway through the second half. For the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">2011–12 season</a>, both he and teammate <a href="Alberto%20Escassi">Alberto Escassi</a> were loaned to <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a> side <a href="H%C3%A9rcules%20CF">Hércules CF</a>.
On 10 July 2012, Sardinero (and Escassi) signed permanently with Hércules, penning a three-year contract. From 2014 and over six seasons, after their <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">relegation from the second tier</a>, he competed in the <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a>.
Sardinero joined <a href="OFI%20Crete%20F.C.">OFI Crete F.C.</a> of the <a href="Super%20League%20Greece">Super League Greece</a> on 22 June 2020, on a two-year contract.
